page.title: 14THE FOOTBALL CLUB
page.content: Stanford Football Club is on the outskirts of the village. It has a large grassed area with two pitches and a club house.The club is run by village people. They raise funds through activities. The pitch is owned by the council. The club is for members only. The club has a meeting every Monday. There is bingo on Tuesdays. Other organizations in the village use the club for whist drives. The annual fete is in July. Usually two fairs use the field, the first in June the other at the end of July. This season Stanford Football Club have 47 players signed on. Once the players have signed on they can't play for another team unless they get transferred. The teams are made up of local players. The first team plays in North Berks Division 2 and the reserves play in Division 4.
